thread.title: COMMUNITY NOTES: Band offers bagpipe lessons, more
thread.title_full: COMMUNITY NOTES: Band offers bagpipe lessons, more - Press Enterprise

author: The Press-Enterprise
title: COMMUNITY NOTES: Band offers bagpipe lessons, more
text:
Published: Oct. 1, 2015 12:25 p.m. COMMUNITY NOTES: Band offers bagpipe lessons, more Print Photo Share Pin It 1 of 2 More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Iris Critchell recently visited the P-38 Museum in Riverside. Critchell flew 25 different types of airplanes as a civilian ferry pilot during WWII. She served under the Women's Auxiliary Ferrying Squadron and later the Women’s Army Service Pilots. She stands next to her uniform, which she donated to the museum. , COURTESY OF P-38 NATIONAL ASSOCIATION, INC. Related article » University to celebrate new football season REDLANDS – Community members are invited to help the University of Redlands kick off its first home Bulldog football game at Rah Rah Redlands Saturday at Ted Runner Stadium. Open swim is 3 to 5 p.m. at Thompson Aquatic Center. Family activities and food trucks is 4 to 7 p.m., which is when the game starts.
Tickets are available at 2:45 p.m. the day of the event at the Frank Serrao Gateway. Admission is free for children ages 3 and under.
Information: redlands.edu
– Staff report
Mexican Consulate to host health fair SAN BERNARDINO – Free medical exams, dental screenings and resources will be available at the 15th Annual Binational Health Fair 9 am to 2 pm Sunday at the Mexican Consulate at 293 N. D St., San Bernardino. There will also be a children’s zone with interactive educational activities, child passenger restraint demonstrations and other resources for parents.
Information: Ventanilla de Salud at the the Mexican Consulate, 909-889-7846
– Staff report
Bagpipe lessons offered RIVERSIDE – The UC Riverside Pipe Band will offer a beginning bagpipe class starting 5:30 p.m. Oct. 13 at the university’s Student Recreation Center. Classes are open to the public and instruction is geared for beginners with no prior musical experience required.
The cost is $20 per quarter for UCR students and $30 for everyone else. A practice chanter, required for instruction, will be sold the first night.
Information: mike.terry@alumni.ucr.edu
– Staff report
Elvis impersonator to perform RIVERSIDE – American Legion Post 79 is holding a fundraiser for the Honor Flight program, which flys World War II, Korea and Vietnam veterans to Washington, D.C. to see the miiltary memorials.
A show featuring Elvis impersonator Ken Sellers and crooner John Trevino is 3 to 5 p.m. Sunday at the post, 2979 Dexter Drive in Riverside’s Fairmount Park. Admission is $5. Food will be available during intermission.
Information: Ramon, 951-870-6205
– Staff report
Riverside International Raceway topic of presentation RIVERSIDE – Auto racing expert Pete Lyons will discuss his new book on the legacy of the Riverside International Raceway at the Riverside Historical Society luncheon meeting, 11:30 a.m. Sunday in the dining commons at La Sierra University. The vegetarian lunch, open to the public, is $10.
Reservations are not mandatory but requested. To RSVP, contact Madeleine Green at 951-780-2313 or seagreen21@aol.com.
– Staff report
Send items for possible inclusion in Community Notes to community@pe.com.
